title: Loudoun Convention & Visitors Association, Golf, Loudoun County VA, 2006
name: Loudoun Convention & Visitors Association, Golf, Loudoun County VA, 2006
description: This dataset provides a listing of Golf Courses in and around Loudoun County VA. Points provide information such as a website and descriptions. All descriptions and other information are from the Visit Loudoun Website.

properties.descript: Algonkian Regional Park Golf Course remains one of the area's most popular public courses. Algonkian's front nine tree-lined fairways are long, straight and flat while the back nine features hills and several dogleg and water holes. Keep track of your game on Algonkian's USGA Handicap System. Work on your swing or putting on the 18-station driving range, practice putting green, or with a lesson from the course teaching professional. Full-service pro shop and snack bar. Electric and pull carts are available. No metal spikes are permitted.
properties.hours: Mon-Fri 7am-dark Sat, Sun & Holidays 6am-dark Seasonal, call for tee times

properties.descript: Brambleton is a championship 18-hole, par-72 course with a driving range, pro-shop and snack bar offering a variety of challenging holes with scenic woods and water holes, large bunkers and plush putting greens.

Premium golf range; lighted, heated, and covered tees; and professional golf instruction. Batting cages (fast and slow pitch), 18-hole miniature golf course, beach volleyball, basketball, and horseshoes. Birthday parties; team, group, and corporate outings; covered pavilions; and catering available.

With 36 holes of championship golf, an additional 9-hole short course designed by Greg Norman, dual practice range, the new 45,000 square foot clubhouse, water complex, as well as access to the luxury resort and its four restaurants, The Golf Club at Lansdowne is the Mid-Atlantic's premier golf destination. The Norman Course has been heralded by Golf Magazine as one of the countries "Top 10 New Courses You Can Play." AVAILABLE TO RESORT GUESTS ONLY.
One of Washington DC's classic designs at a historic value, with beautiful bentgrass greens, plush fairways, and where the great Ben Hogan still holds the course record at 59.

Virginia's only Gary Player designed 18-hole championship golf course featuring deep, stacked sod bunkers and gorgeous scenery. Daily fee, complete practice facilities, corporate golf outings, lessons, pro shop, restaurant, and memberships. Southern colonial-style clubhouse is also available for special events such as weddings and rehearsals, business meetings, parties, and holiday functions. Four-Star Course Rating and the best public golf course in Northern Virginia.

South Riding Golf Club offers a memorable golf experience for players of all skill levels. This Dan Maples design rolls among the hardwood trees, native grass meadows, and water of the northern Virginia countryside. This semi-private facility, located just 10 miles from Dulles International Airport, has been named to Washington Golf Monthly's "Top 100 Courses in the Mid-Atlantic". Complete with practice facilities, full service grill, and a friendly staff, South Riding is a must play!

Virginia National Golf Club was awarded 4 1/2 stars by Golf Digest. The course is, as its name implies, one of Virginia's premier golf layouts. This extraordinary course is set between the scenic Shenandoah River and the Blue Ridge Mountains. Between these two masterpieces of nature lie eighteen holes of golfing splendor. Located on Route 7 at the Shenandoah River, just 22 minutes from Leesburg. It's closer than you think!
Well maintained course with open fairways, rolling terrain, and meandering creeks.
